"to senior researchers here: give the space to younger scientists to go into @science4policy or other #scicomm if they would like to!"
-panel member Ed Hawkins
10/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
"We need to give governments COURAGE to ACT" and (paraphrased by me) we scientists can give them this with our scientific research!
&
"Industry can move very fast if the signal (me: we provide) is CLEAR"
-panel member Philippe Tulkens
9/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
Maybe we should start to leverage citizen panels more. We find that generally, citizen panels go further in their recommendations than governments because (1) they are not lobbied & (2) they do not need to be re-elected
-panel member Philippe Tulkens
8/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
"We should start bringing actors on the ground to tell our stories of climate change. E.g. Farmers are the ones witnessing climate change first hand and have very powerful knowledge/stories to tell"
-panel member
7/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
" We should stop thinking that everything will happen exactly as models tell us it will happen. We should expect the unexpected"
-panel member
6/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
"Beware of saying that climate change is a problem for the next generation. The CURRENT generation is the one that should ACT and it is therefore their responsibility to DO SO"
-panel member
5/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
On the theme of perhaps needing to move away from capitalism: "We don't have the time to wait for capitalism to be overhauled. We still have a lot of capitalist tools that can be useful if used *well*"
-panel member
4/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
(paraphrased by me) "We need to spend more time attracting other disciplines, in particular economists. We should spend time to learn their language [...] We should involve them in the IPCC reports, conferences, etc"
-panel member Philippe Tulkens 
3/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2
user_description: Postdoc @ELI_UCLouv, Antarctic climate research, communicatecryosphere to all (@APECSbelgium, @EGU_CR), science4policy, runner & hiker, mom, views my own.

text:
"The science of attribution is going to be very important".
"Also the lawyers are going to help us in this fight"
-panel member Elena Lopez-Gunn 
2/n @EGU_Policy #EGU23 #GDB2

text: RT @KHayhoe: A fascinating discussion in our #EGU23 session today on if and how climate scientists should be activists. I believe activism takes many forms, from what we research to how we engage; and when we all lose is when we sow division by judging our allies. ¬´ KHayhoe: The other day, I decided to conduct an experiment. I set a timer for 3 hours and counted how many times I was publicly shamed here on twitter during that time. The answer? 12. And since then I've counted dozens of examples of others being shamed, as well. (thread) ‚Äî https://twitter.com/khayhoe/status/1441892742620139520 ¬ª
user_description: Nerdy science & history lover, BLM üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà ally. There is no planet B üåé! Opinions subject to change. Everyone deserves a chance to earn forgiveness.

text: RT @KHayhoe: A fascinating discussion in our #EGU23 session today on if and how climate scientists should be activists. I believe activism takes many forms, from what we research to how we engage; and when we all lose is when we sow division by judging our allies. ¬´ KHayhoe: The other day, I decided to conduct an experiment. I set a timer for 3 hours and counted how many times I was publicly shamed here on twitter during that time. The answer? 12. And since then I've counted dozens of examples of others being shamed, as well. (thread) ‚Äî https://twitter.com/khayhoe/status/1441892742620139520 ¬ª
